DataElement.preferredName: Cytogenetic Abnormality Chromosomal Inversion Chromosome 3 Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not there was a chromosomal inversion of chromosome 3.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cytogenetic Abnormality Chromosomal Inversion Chromosome 3 Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material._A type of chromosome rearrangement in which a segment has been turned through 180 degrees (inverted), and inserted back into its original location on the chromosome._The designation for each member of the third largest human autosomal chromosome pair. Chromosome 3 spans almost 200 million base pairs and represents about 6.5% of the total DNA in normal diploid cells._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material.

Chromosome 3 spans almost 200 million base pairs and represents about 6.5% of the total DNA in normal diploid cells.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A type of chromosome rearrangement in which a segment has been turned through 180 degrees (inverted), and inserted back into its original location on the chromosome.

The designation for each member of the third largest human autosomal chromosome pair. Chromosome 3 spans almost 200 million base pairs and represents about 6.5% of the total DNA in normal diploid cells.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.
